item.title: Setup a double branch model for GitHub Pages and Hugo
item.description: I’ve mentioned in my “Hello World” post that I’ve followed Roman Coedo’s comprehensive guide for setting up this website. One key element of the setup described in his article is the two branch model: master for the generated content that will be served by GitHub Pages, and source - for keeping the Hugo source content under version control. The approach for setting up branches described there is the following: $ git clone git@github.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: The “launch a blog” item has been on my todo list for a very long time. I must admit, way too long. And it would’ve stayed there longer if I wouldn’t have stumbled upon this post, which talks about setting up a blog using Github Pages, Hugo, and Travis CI. Since I haven’t used any of them, and the end result appealed to me, I’ve decided to give it a try.
